brewery.brewery_description:
Trouble Brewing was founded when three friends, Thomas Prior, Stephen Clinch and Paul O Connor had visited one too many pubs that had no variety in the beers available, and decided that something needed to be done about it. So over a few of Thomas’s home-brewed bottles they set about starting a brewery that would go some way to addressing the issue.

Figuring that beer should be presented in a humorous and fun way, they chose to name the brewery Trouble Brewing. The brewing equipment was procured from Sioux Falls in South Dakota, USA and set-up in Allenwood, Co. Kildare.

beer.beer_description: Ambush Pale Ale pours a hazy light straw colour with a soft pillowy white head, aromas of pineapple, mango and candied lemon come bursting out of the glass. Taste is smooth, fresh and juicy with same flavours carrying through along with subtle hints of honeydew melon and tangerine. A combination of low carbonation and high quantity of oats give the beer a silky mouthfeel, like sipping on a soft fluffy cloud.

Ambush Pale Ale pours a hazy light straw colour with a soft pillowy white head, aromas of pineapple, mango and candied lemon come bursting out of the glass. items.badge_description: Wine isn't the only beverage worthy of pairing with a delicious meal. With so many styles widely available, there’s a perfect pint for any cuisine of your choosing. That's a beer at 5 different venues categorized as a Restaurant. Try 5 more for Level 2!

As the hub of the town's social scene, your local pub has what you're craving. Be sure to stop by for a pint or two! That's a beer at 15 different venues with the categories of Pub, Irish Pub or Gastropub. Visit 5 more for Level 4!

beer.beer_description: Bursting with coffee, chocolate and caramel flavours as a result of the complex malt profile. The hops complement the malt flavours for a beer that is smooth and well-balanced. Badged as "Dark Clouds" in the UK.

items.checkin_comment: Bambino ur pizza was sensational, the beer on the other hand…uh oh! A very bland and watery beer, not bad just pretty tasteless. It’s the kind of beer you’d drink 10 in a row if you did not care about taste and just wanted to get drunk. Not a good thing!!

user.bio: France is bad at making beer

beer.beer_description: House beer at Bambino pizza, Dublin. An easy drinking American style lager that pairs wonderfully with our pizza!

items.badge_description: Wouldn’t it be nice if milk stouts came directly from beer producing cows? While this unfortunately isn’t the case (yet) they do have a full body and sweetness due to a larger amount of lactose and sugars. That's 270 different beers with the style of Milk / Sweet Stout. beer.beer_description: Ambush Pale Ale pours a hazy light straw colour with a soft pillowy white head, aromas of pineapple, mango and candied lemon come bursting out of the glass. Taste is smooth, fresh and juicy with same flavours carrying through along with subtle hints of honeydew melon and tangerine. A combination of low carbonation and high quantity of oats give the beer a silky mouthfeel, like sipping on a soft fluffy cloud.

Bursting with coffee, chocolate and caramel flavours as a result of the complex malt profile. The hops complement the malt flavours for a beer that is smooth and well-balanced. Badged as "Dark Clouds" in the UK.

Brewed exclusively for P.Mac’s, Cassidy’s and Blackbird pubs, this extremely hoppy. The aroma dominates with intense floral and citrus against a relatively simple malt profile with just some crystal rye malt to help enhance the spicy character of the hops.

This session pale ale packs a flavourful punch beyond its modest ABV. High proportions of Munich and crystal malts make for a complex flavour with notes of biscuit and hints of caramel. The beer is then heavily hopped with Citra and Amarillo with light fruity aromas and a refreshing bitterness to balance the sweet malts.
The perfect spring beer. Clean, crisp and packed with flavour.

beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
beer.beer_description: New England Double IPA.

A clean and refreshing lager beer infused with passion fruit. This beer has medium body from the lager malt but has a big juicy passion fruit flavour coming through, combined with a good dash of tropical fruitiness from the Citra and Simcoe hops.
Cherry chocolate stout.
Collaboration with Taphouse Ranelagh.

Dry hopped with Mandarina Bavaria and conditioned on 50 kilos of puréed mandarins. 

This 5.5% lager is super smooth, has a beautiful orange ? aroma and a lovely zesty finish.
Saison aged in white wine barrels.
DDH DIPA.
Milk Stout.
Sabro, Mosaic, Azacca, El Dorado.

Weisse City  is a  tart, refreshing wheat ale. A kettle sour Berliner Weisse brewed with raspberry purée to recreate the traditional ‘mit syrup’ serving. Bready wheat notes provide a soft background and delicate mouthfeel, while the fruit and acidic flavours contrast to create a very refreshing, but undeniably uniquely flavoured brew.

Collaboration brew with The WhiteHag as part of Boxstravaganza 2020. A 3% Table Beer, with a medium body. Bright Eyes pours a clear golden brown colour. Heavily dropped hopped with centenial and cascade it has an old school earthy, piney flour and finishes with the bitterness of a west coast pale ale.
Stout with peanut butter and raspberry. Collaboration with Storm Crow Brewing.
Dry-hopped Australian pale ale with Summer and Vic Secret hops
West coast IPA.
Sabro, Mosaic, Columbus.
